territorial_differences.description: Section 60 states that the system of 'registered social landlords' under Part 1 of the Housing Act 1996 will continue to apply in relation to Wales, while Section 61 amends Part 1 of the Housing Act 1996 to restrict the 'registered social landlord' system to Wales, with specific amendments to the registration process and authority.

territory_texts.England: This Part replaces the system of  “registered social landlords” under Part 1 of the Housing Act 1996 (c. 52).
territory_texts.Wales: That Part will continue to apply in relation to Wales (see section 61).
territory_texts.England and Wales:
Part 1 of the Housing Act 1996 (c. 52)
					(social rented sector) is amended as follows (and the title of Part 1 becomes  “Social Rented Sector in Wales”).

territorial_differences.what_is_different: Appropriate authority for consent to disposals
territorial_differences.description: Section 191 specifies that the 'appropriate authority' for consent to certain disposals of housing is the Regulator of Social Housing for England and the Welsh Ministers for Wales.

territory_texts.England: (2A) “ The appropriate authority ” means— (a) in relation to a disposal of land in England by a registered provider of social housing, the Regulator of Social Housing, (b) in relation to any other disposal of land in England, the Secretary of State,
territory_texts.Wales: (2A) “ The appropriate authority ” means— (c) in relation to a disposal of land in Wales, the Welsh Ministers.

other_sections.description: These sections explicitly state their application to England, excluding Greater London, without altering the substantive content of the provisions.
These sections apply uniformly across the United Kingdom, with references to territories to ensure clarity and avoid ambiguity.
These sections explicitly state their application to England, ensuring clarity in the territorial extent without altering the substantive content.
These sections explicitly state their application to Wales, ensuring clarity in the territorial extent without altering the substantive content.
This section explicitly states its application to Northern Ireland and Scotland, ensuring clarity in the territorial extent without altering the substantive content.
These sections explicitly state their application to specific territories, ensuring clarity in the territorial extent without altering the substantive content.
